visualization_prompt: Generate a dual-axis time-series line chart showing hourly energy consumption patterns across time zones using Highcharts with timezone configuration

visualization_code.CSS: * {font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;}.container {min-width: 300px; max-width: 800px; height: 250px; margin: 1em auto;}

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two univariate time series (12-hour energy consumption) with UTC timestamps. Synthetic data was generated with: Berlin series μ=97.4kW, σ=43.1kW showing morning ramp-up; NYC series μ=94.2kW, σ=47.3kW with sharper midday peak. Both maintain temporal coherence through Date.UTC formatting and hourly intervals. The spline charts maximize data-ink ratio by eliminating markers while preserving trend visibility. Color choices (blue=Berlin, red=NYC) follow Cairo's preattentive processing principles for instant differentiation. Timezone configuration demonstrates equivalent UTC moments interpreted through local cultural contexts (business hours vs night periods). Statistical anchors reflect realistic facility load patterns: Berlin's earlier industrial schedule vs NYC's extended commercial operations.
